author: sudorum
title: best adventure set
review: this set is full of traps and other rare pieces. it comes with rare minifigs, such as indie, jock, and belloq. It comes with a different flame piece than usual, it is brighter than normal. the golden idol is possiby the coolest lego piece ever produced. the boulder that falls is a little hard to position, but its easy to get the hang of it. The only crummy part of this set is the flick-a-fire spears. the company could have produced a more ingenious way of making them fire. otherwise, this is a great set indeed.

author: ngclarkiv
title: Temple Escape: a nice touch
review: I have recently just bought this set and probably my most favorite part of the whole thing is the figure Indiana Jones.  When I first bought this set and built it, I wasn't quite stunned or thought it was one of the best sets I owned but it does bring a nice touch to my collection.  I think it is more of a set built for youngsters to play with because it only 554 pieces to build with and its easy to build.  So if you are a collector and are looking into get this set, don't be prepared to be amazed.  The stone and door do not work the greatest although the stones falling from where Indy grasps the golden idol is not bad.. I give it three because I fealt that it didn't meet my needs as a collector. However if you want to relive the first scene of Indiana Jones: Raiders of the Lost Ark it is a great set and I personally suggest that you buy it.

author: lego12
title: This set is awesome!
review:
The set has a TON of pros so let me give you a list....
 
  Pros

1. The Bi-plane is really cool.
2. All the traps are nicely built and work well....except for one...
3. The golden idol is really cool and its rare.
4. The boulder is a rare piece.
5. The spiders and bats are cool.
6. It gives you lots of leaves.
7. It has 2 skeletons, Indiana Jones, Belloq, Satipo, and Jock(the person who flies the plane).
8. It has TONS of playability.
9. It has six traps.
10. It has a good amount of gold coins.

  The traps include: The swinging knives(later used for skeleton swords for the Castle series), the boulder, the closing door, the big gap or hole, the flicking spears, and the tumbling rocks that fall when the idol is removed.

  Now there are some cons.....

   Cons

1. The spider web is in the way of the passage so Indy can't get through.
2. The Bi-plane can't fit Indy unless you remove his backpack.
3. They didn't include a native(indian) in the set.
4. The set is overpriced by $10.00.
5. The closing door closes too fast, but its the best they could do.
 
  Those are the only cons and this set has a lot more pros than cons and it is a fun set to play with and to look at. Thanks for reading this review and I hope you enjoyed it!
                               Lego12

author: Lego_o_Lego
title: GREAT SET!
review:
Here are the PROS and Cons.

Cool boulder!

And the Golden Idol!

Cons:
The Boulder has to be in the right place to work.

Temple Escape is a great set!

author: DVDWow
title: A Fun, Huge Indy Set, With A Few Flaws
review:
The biggest of the classic Indiana Jones sets is simply wonderful in recreating the arguably most famous scene from the original. This set has a pretty low piece count for the amount you spend, but it uses the pieces extremely well, and has a superb artistic design and numerous traps.

Now the traps, despite including the famous boulder chase and numerous other clever traps straight from the movie, work mediocre at best. They fall under "work better in theory than in practice." The boulder while clearly the cornerstone of this set, is quite figidity, and requires a lot of effort to get it set up correctly, and the falling door that allows the boulder to fall doesn't always stay up symmetrically due to the way the lever is set up. I did like the falling "rocks" when you steal the treasure at the end of the temple though, and it works wonderfully. 

Another odd choice by LEGO was to have a bunch of coins just lying around the set. I just opted to remove them as it's difficult to move the display without knocking them all over the place.

Also the display is unusually bulky especially in terms of its length. It's one of the longest sets I own, and has quite a bit of filler space at certain points. I don't particularly like how the set takes a 45-degree turn 2/3 of the way through, as it makes it difficult to display in my setup.

The Biplane is superb, and is easily one of the best planes LEGO has come out with. Indy doesn't fit in it with his bag, but that's easily fixed. 

One of the best parts of this set is just the sheer number of minifigs it comes with including Indy, Jock, Satipo and Belloq as well as a few skeletons.

Building the set overall was a very positive experience, though it was difficult to build some parts of it while the baseplates were connected by the somewhat flimsy hinges. Part of the problem for me was that I don't have a large enough hard surface to build on, but it was easily solved by hinging together the set at the end. 

Overall, I really enjoyed this set, but it has too many flimsy traps, doesn't display easily, and is a difficult assembly to rate it with a 5. Obviously, this set is a must have for Indy enthusiasts, especially those of the classic films, but it's also too overpriced for the number of pieces included.

Design: 4
Build: 3
Pieces/Price: 3
Playability: 5
Minifigs: 5

Total: 20/25 = 4.0

author: indykid
title: Best Raiders Set
review: This set is amazing! It has a lot of playability and all the traps from the film! Lets start with the pros & cons. Pros: 4 minifigs and 1 skeleton; has new torch and a fishing rod and don't forget Reggie the snake; has rare golden idol (WARNING: Don't hold golden idol too much or the paint will start to rub off. this happened with my set except my golden idol still has some paint left on it); has rare boulder that was ponly released in one other set; has cool bi-plane. Cons: could have come with a hovito or two but whatever; pontoons on plane dont stay on very easily when first built.   This is a great set! i highly recommend it. Overall it is a 5/5

author: THX_1138
title: Pretty good, but could have been better
review:
This set is pretty good.
Pros:
-Good minifigs
-The new idol is awesome
-The rolling boulder is sweet and works well
-The closing door is cool
-Jock's seaplane is cool
-The falling statue works pretty well
-The wing struts on OB-CPO are actually dark bley, not white. I think this looks better.
Cons:
-The boulder area isn't nearly long enough-should be at least 2, maybe 3 times the size
-The pit is too small and due to the triangular shape a minifig could just hop over it
-The darts are too big and don't work very well. the one place I actually want flick-fire missiles they don't use them!
-The engine cowling on OB-CPO is black, not white
-The engine in OB-CPO is tan. Light or dark bley would have been better
-It has stickers (I don't care but some do)
This is a pretty good set, but there are better Indy sets out there.

author: lotographia
title: Nothing to mark it down for.
review:
I've seen pictures of the next Indiana Jones biplane and it looks much better than this one, but until I saw the pictures I thought this biplane was pretty darn cute. Maybe they'll remake it in the future to match the size of later biplanes?

I'm not a fan of action gimmicks, being more interested in more complicated adult-oriented designs, but I AM a fan of Indiana Jones, so I had to have this set. I do acknowledge that as action gimmicks go, these ones are actually pretty good. I like the way when the door drops down it tips the boulder over.

Lots of good pieces in this set, lots of nifty stickers if you like that sort of thing. The idol is definitely going in my Indy museum...

author: IndyMan
title: Needs a little more room, LEGO.
review:
My brother and I got this set together, built it, and played with it. Its a great set, but I would recommend not buying this for two people. Its not that roomy, and it is hard to move the minifigs around. Here is what I think about it:

Pros: Indy, Jock, Plane, Belloq, Satipo, Boulder, Cool Pieces, Temple, and Idol.

Cons: Not much playing room, and the boulder doesn't go down very easy.

I would only get this set for one person, not two. Other than that, great set!

Thanks!

author: Noah1997
title: Throw me the Idol
review:
I got this set for $15.00!  it was on clearance me and my little brother split it It was great! the only problem was the door didn't stay up, it has great playability It comes with a lot of mini-figures, the plane is great even though Indiana Jones had to go in sideways, when you pull up the stick that has the Idol on it the rocks on the big head start to fall off if you hit the darts from the back they can shoot out, the door opens and closes, and boulder rolls pretty fast! author: donneyboy
title: "Jock, start the engines, get it up, Jock start the engines!"
review:
I got this set for a birthday present, and it is a good set. First you get 5 bags of parts, 1 bag 1, 1 bag 2, 2 bag 3's, and 1 bag 4. Bag one builds the minifigs, and plane. You get 4 minifigs, and 2 skeletons. The minifigs are Indy (of course), Jock, Belloq, and Satipo. Only Jock has back printing, and it says "Air Pirates". I find it funny how the plane says OB-CPO (Obi Wan, and C-3PO). Jock even has his fishing pole. Bag 2 builds the entrance to the temple. There is not much to talk about there. Bag 3 builds the middle of the temple. You get 2 blades that swing down, and the boulder. To activate the boulder you close the door, and it has a piece that hits the boulder, and then it starts rolling. You also get where Indy walks across to get to the idol. Bag 4 builds the end of the temple. That includes the idol, you pull that up and a wall collapses, and two 2x2 round bricks come crashing down.  When you put it all together it is freaking huge. It is quite large, 21 inches to be exact. It took me about 2.5 hours to complete. I built it while watching Raiders Of The Lost Arc. 

Pros- 
Minifigs
size
plane
idol

Cons- 
Sometimes the door doesn't work
Could of included some Hovitos

author: kongunui
title: temple of the inca's!
review:
When I got this set, I was over the moon with happiness, Indiana Jones Lego had just come out so I was thrilled. I will try to do a better review too, thanks for not being afraid to give your opinions on them, but enough rambling and onto the set.

THE SET

BUILDING
Building this set is not too hard, depending on which section you build, the boulder section being the hardest while the spears trap being the easiest (in my opinion) the building experience is not the best ever which is why I rate it a three.

PARTS
Now, the parts to this set are great and have a Inca golden statue which I think is exclusive to this set, but after a few years the gold begins to chip off, which is annoying. there are plenty of fern/plant bricks too which are helpful, I love the giant stone skulls that are on the walls too. The minifigs are really good and the plane has some rather nice parts too. The accessories are for me though, the highlights of the set. (I'm crazy about accessories though).

PLAYABILITY
Now this is the greatest part of the set, what with the rolling boulder which for me, doesn't work too well (maybe I built it wrong?) there is a rising/falling door which is a neat function. You can flick-fire the spears and I like the way, if the boulder falls, it can go a long way.

CONCLUSION
This is a good set at a good price and if you want to get it I'm behind you, just a slight problem on the building experience so overall I rate it a 4!

author: AETerry
title: Temple Escape Review
review:
Classic, iconic Indiana Jones and movie scene.... For years, alternating off and on, me and my brother would try to recreate a scene like this with Lego, each time refining it when Pirates came out, then Adventurers and so on. And then finally Indiana Jones sets come out. I feel vindicated and excited. One of my favorite movie series brought to LEGO and being able to build it.

 

It's been fun to put this set together, I know I'm an adult now, but to play having Indy run through the corridor of booby traps and then to have to outrun the rolling boulder. You even have the seaplane with his companion who helps him escape the natives and fly back to the States.

 

The details in this set are great for LEGO and the little trap workings have been fun to mess around with. About the only part of this scene that the set is missing is the pit that opens up that Indy swings across on his whip to outrun the boulder.

 

I thing that could have been done differently is to have had a couple of native minifigures attacking Inday as he flees the Temple area. Still, this is a fun and iconic set that's sure to become a classic in LEGO.

author: GroovFlowr
title: Rockin' Raiders Birthday
review:
My fianc√© (now husband) gave this to me three years ago for my 28th birthday, and I LOVED IT! I've been an Indy and LEGO fan since as far back as I can remember, and this was just perfect!


I hadn't really built a LEGO set in some years, and it was great to just plop down on the floor and dig in. The pieces are all neatly bagged by section of the instructions, but I found it was more fun to open everything up and dump it into a big bowl so I had to hunt around for the piece I needed next - more like the old days. (Although I feel like there are almost too many specialised pieces nowadays...) My 28 year-old knees didn't appreciate sitting in that position for so long, but I had a blast.


I still love this set. It sits out proudly on display, and our friends are always playing with it when they come over. So much fun!

author: 26starwars
title: "No Time To Argue, You Throw Me The Idol I'll Throw You The Whip"!!
review:
Name: Indiana Jones and The Temple Escape

Minifigures: Indiana Jones (reg), Satipo, Dr Belloq, Jock and two Skeletons

Weapons/Accessories: Indy's whip, a gun, a spear, golden idol (exclusive piece), a fidhing rodd, some coins, 2 spiders, a bat and a snake

Also Includes: The temple and a biplane

Cons:

author: legofan266
title: "No Time To Argue, You Throw Me The Idol I'll Throw You The Whip!!"
review:
Indiana Jones:

Indiana Jones, is obviously in every set. This set is no different. He comes with a whip and and that is about it. He has his leather jacket and his fedora. He also has a rubery side bag, which is very neat. His whip can fold out just like in the movie ;P

 

Satipo:

This figure only ever appears in this set. He was with Indy at the start, but obviously he turns evil and he dosn't throw him the whip, like he promised he would. He has a very unique torso and that is about it. His face is the same as the majority of the other German Soldiers. His hair is also the same hair piece as Harry Potters. It would of been nice if they made him a little more unique, by making a printed back for this figure of maybe spiders on his back?? That would of been nice. A tourch is also included for this figure.

 

Dr Renee Belloq:

This figure is exclusive. He has a very nice looking jungle outfit, including his torso and his beanie. His Beanie is the same as Dr Henry Jones, just a different colour. This figure is one of the main characters in Raiders Of The Last Ark movie, but sadly this is the only set he is in. This figure does come with a revolver.

 

Jock:

He is a pretty rare fig. He is the guy that owns the biplane in the movie and ofcourse in this set. He is the only minifig in this set that has printed back. On his back it says "Air Pirates" which is exactly like in the movie :D He as a pretty simple smiley face, which I think is new. It's not Luke Skywalkers face by any chance. He also has a fishing rodd which I also think is exclusive. He also has a pet snake which is placed in the biplane, like in the movie

 

Skeletons:

There are 2 skeletons included in this set, one that comes with a spear, which should be placed near the spider web and th other one should be placed near the 3 spikes.

 

Biplane:

This is Jock's biplane, in the movie. The biplane is slightly different to 7198 biplane. There is not much to say about the plane, it has some stickers and ofcourse it has a green snake inside.

 

Temple:

The temple has a sticker on the front, showing some spiders, some plant and a skull piece. Inside there are 2 spiders and a little trap which is supposed to work on Satipo on the way back and thats how he gets killed. There is also a spider web and 2 Skeletons as mentioned above. Then there is the pit. The pit is a bit small, I would have to say. Then there is some spears, representing the darts that are shot in the movie. Except the spears are a bit too big to be used as darts and they fall out unlike the flick-fire missles. Then there is a bat and if you go to the end, there is the golden idol. There is also a set of coins on there. The golden idol is an exclusive piece and it's only in this set. To activate the idol play feature, you have to take the whole bar piece out with the idol attached to it. Not just the idol piece, but the whole bar. Then what that does, just like in the movie, it drops 2 rocks. There is also a lever that when you push up on, it closes the door. Now the problem is, not only the door closes way too fast, but also at the same time, when the door closes it also activates the boulder. Both the door and the boulder are way too fast for Indy, but still it's nice that they went to all that detail. Another accurate thing is that the boulder dosn't fit through the door ;P

 

Conclusion:

This is a good set to get, both the play features and the figures are really good and I really like the movie scene, which was one of the main reasons I bought this set. If you want this set, go a head and get it now, it's deffinetely worth it for about $60USD to $80USD.

 

Pros:

- Lots of animals and accessories

- 3 exclusive figures

- Lots of play features

- Lots of exclusive parts, such as the boulder piece and the golden idol

- 5 gaint base plates (good for mocs)

- Good value for the piece amount

Cons:

- You have to take the whole bar out to activate the idol mechanism instead of just the idol

- Both the boulder and the door are way to fast for Indy

- Stickers (not many though)

author: Brickdroid
title: A Good Set for a Famous Scene!
review:
Indiana Jones took the movie theaters by storm in 1981 with the release of "Raiders of the Lost Ark", so it is only fitting that Indy get's his own line of lego sets! When this set was released in 2008, I was in elementary school, I remember saving up every bit of my precious allowance for months so I could buy this set.  As soon as I got enough money, I rushed straight to my nearest Wal-Mart and purchased this set.  So let's don the fedora, pick up the whip, and take a look at this famous scene, brick by brick!

Box/Instructions

The packaging was pretty standard for the time, with an exciting action scene on the front cover, and the back showing most of the play features for the set.  The instructions, like all sets in the Indiana Jones series, were printed to look like one of Dr. Jones' diaries, and were quite easy to follow. 

Parts

For the most part, the parts in this set were pretty standard. Aside from some neat green-and-grey mountain pieces, which can be good for MOC's, the golden idol, and 4 grey dinousarus, the pieces contained in this set were common.

Minifigures

The Indiana Jones minifigure in this set is the standard Indy from the early batch of sets, but he looks exactly like the adventurer, and even comes with Indy's famous whip and fedora.  Satipo is a minifigure exclusive to this set, and, apart from his torso, is made up of common pieces.  He has the face used for most german soldiers in the Indiana Jones sets, and has Harry Potter's hair.  Rene Belloq is another set-exclusive minifig, and is very nice to have, given that he is the main antagonist in the film.  For the most part, he DOES look like Belloq in his jungle gear, but I never liked this particular minifig's face.  I really just didn't like his sneer, but it certainly could have been worse. Finally, we come to Jock, who is really neat in that he had a very small role in the movie,  but is featured in the set anyway.  I really liked this minifig, even though he was pretty generic.

The build

The actual construction of this model was very straightforward, and very easy, to the point that there is really nothing more that I can say about it other than the fact that you will have next to no trouble with it.

The completed model

This set came out looking fantastic, and it will not break easily. Among my favorite features are the lowering door, the scythes coming out of the wall, and, of course, the rolling boulder!  The sheer amount of booby traps that they were able to fit into this single set was astounding, and it represents the temple well from the movie.
Summary
This model came out very well, extremely if you are looking for playability. Due to the simple construction, this is a very robust set, which is good. There are very few things that could go wrong and break.  It is perfect if your looking for a set that represents this iconic scene in film history, and can be played with, too.  This is a fantastic set, and is highly recommended to all Indiana Jones fans, and people who just want a fun set.
